nl_problem:
# Task: rotate_image_n_by_n
# Interface:
Class: Solution
Method: rotate(self, arg1)

You are given an n x n 2D matrix representing an image, rotate the image by 90 degrees (clockwise).
You have to rotate the image in-place, which means you have to modify the input 2D matrix directly. DO NOT allocate another 2D matrix and do the rotation.

Constraints:
- n == matrix.length == matrix[i].length
- 1 <= n <= 20
- -1000 <= matrix[i][j] <= 1000
lisp_spec:
(task
  (name "rotate")
  (signature ( (matrix (list (list int))) ) void)
  (constraints
    (constraint "n == matrix.length == matrix[i].length")
    (constraint "1 <= n <= 20")
    (constraint "-1000 <= matrix[i][j] <= 1000")
  )
  (goal
    (description "Rotate the given n x n 2D matrix representing an image by 90 degrees clockwise in-place.")
    (rule "The rotation must be performed in-place, modifying the input matrix directly.")
    (return "The function should modify the input matrix directly and return nothing (void).")
  )
)
generated_code:
from typing import List, Optional, Dict, Set, Any
import heapq
import collections

class Solution:
    def rotate(self, matrix: List[List[int]]) -> None:
        """Rotates the given n x n 2D matrix representing an image by 90 degrees clockwise in-place.

        Args:
            matrix: The input n x n 2D matrix.

        Returns:
            None (modifies the matrix in-place).
        """
        n = len(matrix)
        for i in range(n // 2):
            for j in range(i, n - i - 1):
                temp = matrix[i][j]
                matrix[i][j] = matrix[n - 1 - j][i]
                matrix[n - 1 - j][i] = matrix[n - 1 - i][n - 1 - j]
                matrix[n - 1 - i][n - 1 - j] = matrix[j][n - 1 - i]
                matrix[j][n - 1 - i] = temp
